# WORCS

The Workflow for Open Reproducible Code in Science (WORCS) is an easy to
adopt approach to ensuring a research project meets the requirements of
Open Science from the start. It is based on a “good enough” philosophy,
prioritizing user-friendliness over exhaustiveness. It can be used
either in absence of, or in parallel to, existing requirements for Open
workflows. It can also be enhanced with more elaborate solutions for
specific issues.

## Where do I start?

For most users, the recommended starting point is to [read the paper,
published in Data
Science](https://content.iospress.com/articles/data-science/ds210031),
which introduces the WORCS workflow, explains the underlying tools, and
illustrates how the `worcs` package can be used to create a new project
that follows the workflow.

The workflow is illustrated below; the [workflow
vignette](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/articles/workflow.html)
describes each step in detail.

![A diagram of the WORCS
workflow.](https://github.com/cjvanlissa/worcs/raw/master/paper/workflow_graph/workflow.png)

## Installing the package

Before installing the package, please read [this
vignette](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/articles/setup.html), which
explains how to set up your computer for `worcs` (using the CRAN
version).

If you know what you’re doing and you wish to install the development
version of the `worcs` package from GitHub instead, you can use:

``` r
if(!requireNamespace("remotes")) install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("cjvanlissa/worcs", dependencies = TRUE, update = "never")
```

## Citing WORCS

You can cite WORCS using the following citation (please use the same
citation for either the package, or the paper):

> Van Lissa, C. J., Brandmaier, A. M., Brinkman, L., Lamprecht, A.,
> Peikert, A., , Struiksma, M. E., & Vreede, B. (2021). WORCS: A
> Workflow for Open Reproducible Code in Science. Data Science. Data
> Science, vol. 4, no. 1, pp. 29-49. DOI: 10.3233/DS-210031.

## About this repository

This repository contains the following:

1.  An R-package called `worcs`, with convenience functions to
    facilitate the WORCS workflow.
2.  In the subfolder `./paper`, the source files for the paper
    describing the WORCS workflow.

The repository serves two functions: To allow users to install the
`worcs` package, and to allow collaborators access to the source code
for the package and paper.

## Repository structure

| File          | Description                     | Usage           |
|:--------------|:--------------------------------|:----------------|
| \_pkgdown.yml | YAML for package website        | do not edit     |
| DESCRIPTION   | R-package DESCRIPTION           | do not edit     |
| LICENSE.md    | Project license                 | do not edit     |
| NAMESPACE     | R-package namespace             | machine-written |
| README.md     | Read this file to get started!  | do not edit     |
| README.Rmd    | R-markdown source for readme.md | human editable  |
| worcs.Rproj   | RStudio project file            | do not edit     |
| docs/         | Package website                 | machine-written |
| inst/         | RStudio project template files  | human editable  |
| man/          | R-package documentation         | do not edit     |
| paper/        | WORCS paper source files        | human editable  |
| R/            | R-package source code           | human editable  |
| vignettes/    | R-package vignettes             | human editable  |

## Contributing and Contact Information

We are always eager to receive user feedback and contributions to help
us improve both the workflow and the software. Major contributions
warrant coauthorship to the package. Please contact the lead author at
<c.j.vanlissa@uu.nl>, or:

- [File a GitHub issue](https://github.com/cjvanlissa/worcs) for
  feedback, bug reports or feature requests
- [Make a pull request](https://github.com/cjvanlissa/worcs/pulls) to
  contribute your code or prose

By participating in this project, you agree to abide by the [Contributor
Code of Conduct v2.0](https://www.contributor-covenant.org/).
Contributions to the package must adhere to the [tidyverse style
guide](https://style.tidyverse.org/). When contributing code, please add
tests for that contribution to the `tests/testthat` folder, and ensure
that these tests pass in the [GitHub Actions
panel](https://github.com/cjvanlissa/worcs/actions/workflows/R-CMD-check).

## Acknowledgements

The worcs logo is inspired by the Open Science Badges by the Center for
Open Science (CC-BY-4.0), and makes use of the gear, services, gears,
preferences, settings icon, made by MD Badsha Meah from www.freeicons.io
(CC-BY-3.0).

# Package index

## All functions

- [`add_endpoint()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/add_endpoint.md)
  : Add endpoint to WORCS project
- [`add_license_file()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/add_license_file.md)
  : Add License File to Project
- [`add_manuscript()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/add_manuscript.md)
  : Add Rmarkdown manuscript
- [`add_preregistration()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/add_preregistration.md)
  : Add Rmarkdown preregistration
- [`add_recipe()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/add_recipe.md)
  : Add Recipe to Generate Endpoints
- [`add_synthetic()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/add_synthetic.md)
  : Add synthetic data to WORCS project
- [`add_targets()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/add_targets.md)
  : Add targets to WORCS Project
- [`add_testthat()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/add_testthat.md)
  [`test_worcs()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/add_testthat.md)
  : Add testthat to WORCS Project
- [`check_endpoints()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/check_endpoints.md)
  : Check endpoints in WORCS project
- [`check_worcs()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/check_worcs.md)
  : Evaluate project with respect to WORCS checklist
- [`check_worcs_installation()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/check_worcs_installation.md)
  [`check_dependencies()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/check_worcs_installation.md)
  [`check_git()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/check_worcs_installation.md)
  [`check_github()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/check_worcs_installation.md)
  [`check_ssh()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/check_worcs_installation.md)
  [`check_tinytex()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/check_worcs_installation.md)
  [`check_rmarkdown()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/check_worcs_installation.md)
  [`check_renv()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/check_worcs_installation.md)
  : Check worcs dependencies
- [`cite_all()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/cite_all.md)
  : Comprehensive citation Knit function for 'RStudio'
- [`cite_essential()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/cite_essential.md)
  : Essential citations Knit function for 'RStudio'
- [`closed_data()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/closed_data.md)
  : Use closed data in WORCS project
- [`make_codebook()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/codebook.md)
  : Create codebook for a dataset
- [`data_label()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/data_label.md)
  : Label factor variables using metadata
- [`data_unlabel()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/data_unlabel.md)
  : Drop value labels
- [`descriptives()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/descriptives.md)
  : Describe a dataset
- [`export_project()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/export_project.md)
  : Export project to .zip file
- [`git_ignore()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/git_ignore.md)
  : Modify .gitignore file
- [`git_release_publish()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/git_release_publish.md)
  : Publish a Release on 'GitHub'
- [`git_remote_connect()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/git_remote_connect.md)
  : Connect to Existing 'GitHub' Repository
- [`git_remote_create()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/git_remote_create.md)
  : Create a New 'GitHub' Repository
- [`git_update()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/git_update.md)
  : Add, commit, and push changes.
- [`git_user()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/git_user.md)
  : Set global 'Git' credentials
- [`github_action_check_endpoints()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/github_action_check_endpoints.md)
  [`github_action_reproduce()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/github_action_check_endpoints.md)
  [`github_action_testthat()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/github_action_check_endpoints.md)
  : Set up GitHub Actions to Check Endpoints
- [`has_git_user()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/has_git_user.md)
  : Check whether global 'Git' credentials exist
- [`list_endpoints()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/list_endpoints.md)
  : List endpoints in WORCS project
- [`load_data()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/load_data.md)
  : Load WORCS project data
- [`load_entrypoint()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/load_entrypoint.md)
  : Load project entry points
- [`notify_synthetic()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/notify_synthetic.md)
  : Notify the user when synthetic data are being used
- [`open_data()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/open_data.md)
  : Use open data in WORCS project
- [`remove_endpoint()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/remove_endpoint.md)
  : Remove endpoint from WORCS project
- [`reproduce()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/reproduce.md)
  : Reproduce WORCS Project
- [`skew_kurtosis()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/skew_kurtosis.md)
  : Calculate skew and kurtosis
- [`snapshot_endpoints()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/snapshot_endpoints.md)
  : Snapshot endpoints in WORCS project
- [`synthetic()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/synthetic.md)
  : Generate synthetic data
- [`worcs_badge()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/worcs_badge.md)
  : Add WORCS badge to README.md
- [`worcs_checklist`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/worcs_checklist.md)
  : WORCS checklist
- [`worcs_path()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/worcs_path.md)
  : Specify File Path Relative to WORCS Project Directory
- [`worcs_project()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/worcs_project.md)
  : Create new WORCS project
- [`worcs_root()`](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/reference/worcs_root.md)
  : Return Absolute File Path of WORCS Project Directory

### All vignettes

- [Citing references in
  worcs](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/articles/citation.md):
- [Using Endpoints to Check
  Reproducibility](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/articles/endpoints.md):

  repositories](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/articles/git_cloud.md):

  project](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/articles/reproduce.md):

  Docker-edition](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/articles/setup-docker.md):
- [Setting up your computer for
  WORCS](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/articles/setup.md):
- [Using Custom Synthetic
  Data](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/articles/synthetic_data.md):
- [Using targets to Reduce Redundant
  Computations](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/articles/targets.md):
- [The WORCS workflow, version
  0.1.16](https://cjvanlissa.github.io/worcs/articles/workflow.md):
